node.title: A hospital program is supporting women to give birth in their own homes, and the results are positive
node.alt: A woman giving birth to her baby at her home.
node.description: If you'd told Camilla Kennedy five years ago that she would one day give birth at home, she says she probably would have laughed. But just a few weeks ago, the 33-year-old did just that.
node.content:
["If you had told Camilla Kennedy five years ago that she would one day give birth at home, she says she probably would have laughed.", "\"I kind of thought it was a bit alternative \u2026 it's not something I ever thought I would have done.\"", "But just a few weeks ago, the 33-year-old gave birth to her second child in a birthing pool in the lounge room of her Sydney home\u00a0with the help of two midwives, a student midwife, and her partner Alex.", "\"I woke up at about 4 o'clock in the morning and felt mild cramping, so I sat with that for a bit,\" she said.", "\"At about 10 o'clock, [the contractions] really ramped up \u2026 the midwives were here 20 minutes later, and at 2 o'clock, he was born.\"", "Her son Jack was the 100th baby to be born through the homebirth program at Sydney's Royal Hospital for Women.", "", "
Jack was delivered via a home birth.(Supplied: Camilla Kennedy)
", "The program, which was launched in 2018, offers women with low-risk pregnancies the choice of giving birth in their homes at no cost, with the support of two experienced midwives.", "Having already had a drug-free labour with her first child, Camilla said she was drawn to a home birth for her second baby after hearing about the positive experiences of other women.", "She said one of the most welcome parts of the birth was being in the comfort of her own home and not having to worry about when it was time to get up and go to hospital.", "\"At home, I knew I didn't have to go far. I knew people were coming to me,\" she said.", "
Less intervention at home than hospital
", "The Royal Hospital for Women program is one of\u00a0four publicly funded homebirth programs in Sydney, and one of 17 hospital programs nationally.", "It was set up in 2018 in response to growing community interest, and has so far serviced more than 130 women and their families, hospital general manager Donna Garland said.", "\"Three years ago the hospital introduced the option for families to give birth at home supported by the Royal Hospital for Women team, and it has been so successful, seven families even returned for a second birth at home,\" Ms Garland said.", "", "
Camilla's daughter Sadie with her new baby brother, Jack.(Supplied:\u00a0Camilla Kennedy)
", "A recent analysis of hospital data found women who participated in the program had lower rates of medical intervention than women with low-risk pregnancies who had planned hospital births.", "Medical interventions such as caesarean sections, the use of forceps, and vacuum deliveries can be life-saving, but also come with increased risks for mothers and babies.", "The Birth Outcomes data looked at 130 women who intended to give birth at home (as part of the hospital program) and at 370 women \u2014\u00a0also at low risk \u2014\u00a0who intended to give birth at the hospital.", "The analysis found that women planning to birth at home had a higher \"normal\" birth rate (with no intervention) at 90 per cent, compared to 60 per cent in the hospital group.", "Andrew Bisits, director of obstetrics at the Royal Hospital for Women, said the results of the home birth program were better than he expected.", "\"I was a little bit surprised as to how high [the natural birth rate] was,\" Dr Bisits said.", "\"It's not the last word on it, because it's small numbers.", "\"But still, from a strictly statistical point of view, [the figures from the two groups] are quite different.\"", "", "
The program at the Royal Hospital for Women is only available to women who are expected to have a straightforward vaginal delivery.(Supplied: Royal Women's Hospital)
", "Dr Bisits said about a fifth of women in the program had to be transferred to hospital either prior to, or during, labour.", "He said the feedback from participants, including those who were transferred, had been consistently positive.", "\"I've been quite overwhelmed by the stories of women's positive birthing experiences,\" Dr Bisits said.", "Dr Bisits stressed the homebirth program was well integrated into the hospital's mainstream maternity services, and that the participants were carefully screened to ensure their safety.", "\"It doesn't mean that there won't be complications, because there will be. But you can keep those to a minimum.\"", "
Women and babies assessed as low risk
", "In Australia, roughly 0.3 per cent of births are planned home births, compared with 2-3 per cent in Britain and 3-5 per cent in New Zealand.", "For women who don't have access to a publicly funded hospital program, the cost of a home birth with a private midwife is typically around $5,000. This is how most home births occur.", "\"There is a waiting list for [the hospital program],\" Dr Bisits said.", "\"We can't quite meet the demand.\"", "He said home birth still wasn't the preferred option for most low-risk women, but that it was increasingly popular among a select group of \"highly motivated\" individuals who intended to give birth without pain-relief drugs.", "In the program at the Royal Hospital for Women, all women are required to be assessed by an obstetrician a few weeks before their due date to ensure the risk of complications is low.", "\"Around 36 weeks, we just want to make sure that the pregnancy has gone well, that the baby is growing well and is in the right position,\" Dr Bisits said.", "All hospital-supported home births are attended by two midwives, one of whom is involved in the pregnancy the entire way through.", "Dr Bisits says each woman's home is assessed to make sure it's suitable, and within a short distance of the hospital, in the event of any complications.", "\"The hospital is informed when the labour starts,\" he said.", "\"We view a woman birthing at home as being in one of our birthing rooms, except outside of the hospital.\"", "
Data adds to growing evidence
", "Hannah Dahlen, a professor of midwifery and leading maternity care expert from Western Sydney University, said the results of the hospital's home birth program were in line with what other research had shown.", "She said home birth was a safe option for women who were at low risk of birth complications, and who were supported by qualified midwives \"well networked\" into the hospital system.", "She pointed to a 2019 Australian study, which she co-authored, which analysed 1.25 million births.", "The study found planned home births had the highest rate of normal deliveries (95 per cent), followed by midwife-run birthing centres (89 per cent), and hospital labour wards (78 per cent).", "In another 2018 study, Professor Dahlen and her colleagues found women who had a home birth were about two thirds less likely to have a caesarean section, or require forceps or a vacuum delivery.", "\"Women were also half as likely to have very severe tearing at birth, which is something that is also really important,\" she said.", "", "
Hannah Dahlen says hospital homebirth programs are inaccessible to many women, especially in non metropolitan areas.(Supplied:\u00a0Sally Tsoutas)
", "When asked what was behind some of the positive health outcomes for low-risk births at home, Professor Dahlen said the evidence was \"very clear\".", "\"The most powerful part is that women have continuity of midwifery care,\" she said.", "\"They have a midwife who they see through their pregnancy, who comes to their birth, who provides their postnatal care.", "She added that the comfort of the home environment and ability to create a calming atmosphere also contributed to a positive birth experience.", "\"[Women] are able to dim the lights, put on candles, and play music,\" she said.", "\"They feel safe and able to tap into what is an incredibly ancient, animal process.\"", "
Medical bodies urge caution
", "While the Australian College of Midwives \"supports the choice of planned, midwife-attended birth at home as a safe option for women with uncomplicated pregnancies\", other leading medical bodies have cautioned against home births because of rare but unpredictable risks.", "The Royal Australian and New Zealand College of Obstetricians Gynaecologists (RANZCOG)\u00a0backs hospitals as the safest place to give birth.", "But RANZCOG\u00a0says it recognises there is \"a small group of women who are accepting of the associated risks\" with a planned home birth, and says these women \"should be maximally supported in that choice\".", "Professor Dahlen said publicly-funded hospital programs offered \"a more equitable\" solution to women who wanted to give birth at home.", "\"If you can't afford to pay for a private midwife, you're between a rock and a hard place,\" she said.", "\"Whereas a publicly funded system gives you that option without the cost.\"", "In the future, Professor Dahlen said she'd like to see both publicly funded hospital programs, and better-subsidised private home births.", "\"I think it's outrageous that women have to pay out of pocket for a model of care that leads to less harm and has such strong evidence behind it,\" she said.", "\"We make it so hard and punitive for women to be able to have that choice met.\""]
